title: What Happened to FTX? Here’s What to Know.
description: Binance, the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange, was set to bail out FTX. Then it pulled out of the deal.

title: Murdoch’s Outlets, Including Fox News, Extend Criticism of Trump
description: For a second consecutive day, the recriminations about Republicans’ unexpectedly weak Election Day performance played a prominent role on the pages and over the airwaves of Rupert Murdoch’s media properties.

title: Elon Musk Paints Bleak Picture in Email to Twitter Employees
description: In his first communications with Twitter’s staff, the company’s new owner painted a bleak picture as more employees resigned.

title: FTX’s Sam Bankman-Fried Says He Is Trying to Raise More Money
description: Sam Bankman-Fried told employees that he was trying to reinforce his company’s finances days after it collapsed from a bank run.

title: NASA Launched and Landed LOFTID, an Inflatable Flying Saucer Heat Shield
description: The LOFTID mission tested a novel approach to guiding spacecraft through the extreme heat of returning from orbit, which could be used to put people on Mars.

title: Can New Technology Make Home Dialysis a More Realistic Option?
description: The Tablo System promises to make dialysis easier and more convenient for patients. But there are significant barriers to the technology.

title: Tech’s Talent Wars Have Come Back to Bite It
description: Hiring the best, the brightest and the highest number of employees was a badge of honor at tech companies. Not anymore as layoffs surge.

title: L.A. Drops Criminal Charges Against Election Software Executive
description: Eugene Yu was accused of illegally sending data about poll workers to China, in a case that became fodder for election deniers.
